discussion.content: A retinal scan is a biometric technique that maps the unique patterns of a person’s retina using a low-intensity light source. Through a delicate sensor, a retinal scan examines the pattern of retina blood vessels, which remains unchanged from birth until death.

questions.question_text: Which type of scan is used on the eye to measure the layer of blood vessels?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Vulnerable to manually prompting users, e.g. touch ID scams that targeted Apple devices

choices.D: A stored biometric can be stolen and used by an attacker to impersonate the individual identified by the biometric.
choices.A: The digital representation of the biometric might not be unique, even if the physical characteristic is unique.
choices.C: A stored biometric is no longer "something you are" and instead becomes "something you have".
choices.B: Authentication using a stored biometric compares a copy to a copy instead of the original to a copy.

questions.question_text: What is the main reason the use of a stored biometric is vulnerable to an attack?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Sniffing 4-way handshake 
• 4-way handshake is the ceremony between AP and the device 
• Vulnerability in WPA and WPA-Personal (WPA-PSK, pre-shared key) 
• During WPA handshake, password is shared in encrypted form (called PMK (pairwise master key))

choices.C: The tester cannot crack WPA2 because it is in full compliance with the IEEE 802.11i standard.
choices.D: The tester must change the MAC address of the wireless network card and then use the AirTraf tool to obtain the key.
choices.B: The tester must use the tool inSSIDer to crack it using the ESSID of the network.
choices.A: The tester must capture the WPA2 authentication handshake and then crack it.

questions.question_text: During a wireless penetration test, a tester detects an access point using WPA2 encryption. Which of the following attacks should be used to obtain the key?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In case of NV2 wireless protocol, it can be about bi-directional stream.

Selected Answer: A
Omni-directional antenna ▪ Broadcasts in 360 degrees 
 Most common type of antenna used in wireless communications and networks, especially WiFi 
 Used also in wireless base stations 
 Least concentrated and lower range

questions.question_text: Which type of antenna is used in wireless communication?
What is the name of the international standard that establishes a baseline level of confidence in the security functionality of IT products by providing a set of requirements for evaluation?

discussion.content: Common Criteria is a framework in which computer system users can specify their security functional and assurance requirements (SFRs and SARs respectively) in a Security Target (ST), and may be taken from Protection Profiles (PPs). Vendors can then implement or make claims about the security attributes of their products, and testing laboratories can evaluate the products to determine if they actually meet the claims
